pr_title: BREAKING: Improves the admin UI and permission management

timeline.message:
Adds some convenience methods and makes PackageData aware of its scope.

This simplifies some UIs and checks.
Warns if packages are available but none is assigned to the target entity.
Adds the possibility to provide a short description for packages and upgrades.

BREAKING: Reverts a nullability check.

The API was changed to fully handle null arguments (which seems quite counter intuitive).
Therefore we now make it explicit, that null is not accepted for most parameters.
Splits the tenant admin UI into several pages.
Fixes a rendering issue (removes a superfluous row-div).
Improves the output of available packages and upgrades.
Properly splits an extension so separater concerns.
Provides a translation used in the admin UI.
Provides the scope to use for tenant packages and upgrades.

BREAKING: Splits the user-management permissions.

We now distinguish between "managing users of any tenant" and "managing
users of the system tenant" as this is entirely another game.

Previously, every user of the system tenant with the role "user-administrator"
was system administrator. We now introduced now a extra role and also an
extra permission which controls if users of the system tenant may be
updated.

To achieve backwards compatibility, add this to the application.conf:

        "flag-system-tenant-member+user-administrator" {
            priority = 10
	    system-administrator = true
        }

Therefore it is provided as static method rather than a
method in Tenants. It is however intended to be reused
in case an additional controller contributes to the user
management.
Checks if the current user is logged in before trying to access its tenant.
